reviews.text: Purchased in April 2023. 1 side broke February 2025 leaving the switch in the always-on position. Not sure how long a switch should last, but it feels like it should have been longer than this. Functionally, until it broke it worked well. This was in a bathroom that did not receive frequent usage.

reviews.productTitle: ELEGRP Decorator Double Rocker Light Switch, Two Single Pole Electrical Paddle, 15A 120V, In-Wall On/Off, Self-Grounding, Wall Plate Included, UL Listed (1 Pack, Glossy White)
reviews.text: I installed the switch, restored power, and... nothing. I pulled it back out and tested it with a multimeter. Both switches were completely dead. No matter what I did, or how I pressed or wiggled them, I couldn't close either circuit. I had to make a trip to the home store the next day to replace it with one that actually worked. Pros: - It looked nice. Cons: - Completely broken fresh out of the box.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2024
reviews.title: Dead on arrival

reviews.productTitle: ELEGRP Decorator Double Rocker Light Switch, Two Single Pole Electrical Paddle, 15A 120V, In-Wall On/Off, Self-Grounding, Wall Plate Included, UL Listed (1 Pack, Glossy White)
reviews.text: I had bought one of these years ago for my other bathroom and I absolutely loved it. Well now my other one needed one so I looked and found this one. It was a little different from the one I already did before (been 15 years). I got it hooked up and everything works mostly. You don't have to actually push the switch hard to turn it on or off. In fact the switch doesn't have to move at all, just a slight touch and it turns on and off. Unfortunately I took a couple of months to install it, so I missed the return. I'm sure it's just a bad switch, that does happen from time to time. Overall I really do like it very much though.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2024
reviews.title: Nice upgrade for my lighting switch

reviews.text: This switch was a lower cost than local hardware stores, and seems to work well. My condo had just a single switch that turned on both the bathroom lights and fan together. I don't always want the fan on, so this switch made it easy to separate without having to change the wall box.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2023
reviews.title: Perfect switch for separating bathroom light and fan, so you can turn on independently.

reviews.productTitle: ELEGRP Decorator Double Rocker Light Switch, Two Single Pole Electrical Paddle, 15A 120V, In-Wall On/Off, Self-Grounding, Wall Plate Included, UL Listed (1 Pack, Glossy White)
reviews.text: I don't know if the manual is wrong or the design is wrong, but the ground is located under the hot wire, so there is a risk of short circuit if done incorrectly. Rather, I think it would be safer to place the hot wire on the opposite copper nut and use the black nut as a running light wire. Of course, if the two separate wires are from different single phases, you have to do it the same way as before, but the green ground wire is too close to the hot wire, so construction will be done on the shorted line, but it is likely to be too close during construction or when a short circuit such as heat generation occurs. The risk exists.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2023
reviews.title: The location of the grounding part appears to be incorrect.
